etomica.data.types

Class DataGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.data.types.DataGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IData, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataTable, LatticeSumCrystal.DataGroupLSC, LatticeSumCrystalMolecular.DataGroupLSC, LatticeSumCrystalParacetamol.DataGroupLSCParacetamol

    public class DataGroup
extends java.lang.Object
implements IData, java.io.Serializable
    Gathers one or more Data instances into a single Data object. The primary use is to enable a data handler to take a single data stream and emit multiple different streams from it. An example is given by the accumulators, which take data and compile one or more new sets of data from it, and send them out bundled in a DataGroup.

    The Data instances held by the group are set at construction and cannot be changed.

    Data sinks typically need to manipulate DataGroups to extract the individual data elements in them.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • data

        protected final IData[] data

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataGroup

        public DataGroup(IData[] data)
        Forms a data group from the given array of data objects. Given data array is cloned, but the data instances it holds are kept by this DataGroup.

        Dimension associated with the DataGroup is Dimension.MIXED if the Data it holds have different dimensions; otherwise dimension is the common dimension of the grouped Data instances.

        Parameters:
        data - array of data to be encapsulated in this group
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the elements of the Data array are null

    • Method Detail

      • E

        public void E(IData newData)
        Applies the E method to all Data elements held, in a one-to-one correspondence with the elements in the given data group.
        Specified by:
        E in interface IData
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the given data is not an instance of DataGroup.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given DataGroup has a different number of data elements than this DataGroup.

      • getData

        public IData getData(int i)
        Returns the i-th data element in the group, counting from 0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - exception if the given value does not reference a legitimate element
